steps.reason: The paper links SNCA mutations to familial PD and demonstrates their impact on dopamine synthesis genes (e.g., SR and TH) and transcriptional changes.
Gene expression analysis (microarrays + qRT-PCR) directly addresses the role of SNCA in dopamine synthesis, aligning with the disease mechanism.

sub_steps.reason: Wild-type and mutant (A30P, A53T) SNCA were compared, and qRT-PCR confirmed results, implying replicates.
Wild-type (benign) and mutant (pathogenic) variants were used as controls.
The paper does not explicitly report p-values, effect sizes, or OddsPath calculations.
Only 1 benign (wild-type) and 2 pathogenic (A30P, A53T) variants were used, totaling 3 controls (<10).

strength.reason: Functional data shows wild-type SNCA downregulates dopamine synthesis genes, while mutants (A30P, A53T) do not, but statistical rigor is lacking.
